alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:13PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Water begins to flow over Whately Road... which is about 7 miles east of Glasgow. Baseball field at Sullivan Park flooded. At 31.0 feet, Flooding will begin to affect buildings between the Fort Peck Highway and the Milk River east of Glasgow. Sullivan Park will be totally covered by flood waters. At 32.8 feet, Most roads in the lower Milk River Valley are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 27.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Wednesday was 27.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.9 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.9 feet on 09/08/1911. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning by 1100 AM MDT.
